page.title: 12Osprey Electronics.
page.content: Osprey Electronics, founded in 1975 is based at Wick Industrial Estate. They make underwater cameras and are the second largest producers in the world. After the camera is designed the ideas are drawn up on paper by draughts men. Each camera takes about 30 - 40 drawings of all the parts before it is ready to build. In all the completed plans take 12 weeks to draw. The next stage is the machine shop where the aluminium camera parts are cut exactly by computerised machines. The assembly line is where the camera and its electronic parts are put together. The finished camera is checked in pressurised water tanks to see it doesn't leak and withstands pressure. They are sold from Aberdeen for use in inspecting oilrigs, underwater pipelines, etc.
